intro: Octomeria itatiaiae, commonly known as the Itatiaia octomeria, is a rare flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the Atlantic Forest biome. It is known for its unique morphology and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution. Conservation efforts are crucial for its survival due to habitat loss and fragmentation.
